revised_title: The London Bridge Water-Works: A Detailed Explanation of its Mechanism and Function
tldr: This article provides a detailed description of the water-works at London Bridge, explaining the mechanism and function of the engines that raise water from the River Thames. The system uses a series of wheels, levers, and pumps to lift water to a height of 120 feet, with a capacity of 1954 hogsheads per hour. The author also discusses the efficiency of the engines and the factors that can affect their performance.
